content.p: Agriculture, Forestry, Aquaculture and Rural Development Committee, all matters relating to:
Agribusiness programs at penal and correctional institutions
Animal industry and diseases of animals
Human nutrition, plant quarantine, and home living economics
Inspection of livestock and meat products
Plant industry, soils, and agricultural engineering
Commerce, Consumer Protection and International Affairs Committee, all matters relating to:
Communication by telephone, telegraph, radio, television or other media
Protection of trade and commerce against unlawful restraints and monopolies
Registration and licensing of vessels and small boats
Regulation, licensing, and standards of professions, businesses, and occupations
Regulation of common carriers by water
Savings and loan and homestead associations
Education Committee, all matters relating to:
College or university agricultural extension service
Employees of colleges and universities, including pay, except where an appropriation of state funds is required
Employees of vocational-technical education schools, including pay, except where an appropriation of state funds is required
Preservation of historic landmarks and objects
School employees, administrators, teachers, bus drivers, and others
School employees and teachers pay, except where an appropriation of state funds is required
Repealed by SR 168 of 2014 RS, eff. August 1, 2014.
Environmental Quality Committee, all matters relating to:
Finance Committee, all matters relating to:
Appropriation of state funds, including the cash portion of the comprehensive state capital budget
Economy and efficiency of government operations

Each legislative instrument with an estimated fiscal cost, as reflected in the fiscal note prepared in accordance with Joint Rule No. 4, of one hundred thousand dollars or more annually in any one of the three ensuing fiscal years or with a fiscal cost which, although unspecified in the fiscal note, is indicated in the fiscal note to likely exceed one hundred thousand dollars annually in any of the three ensuing fiscal years, after initial consideration in committee of subject matter, if different from Finance.
Court costs or fees imposed by courts.
Health and Welfare Committee, all matters relating to:
Facilities for children with physical disabilities
Mental health, including institutions and facilities
Institutions and services for persons with intellectual disabilities.
Public welfare, including private and local institutions
Public welfare research, training, and rehabilitation
Insurance Committee, all matters relating to:
Insurance generally, except insurance matters placed under the jurisdiction of another committee.
Judiciary C Committee, all matters relating to:
Attorney General, District Attorneys, and prosecutors in general, including compensation, expenses, personnel, facilities, and the like, except retirement matters

Civil Code and Civil Code Ancillaries generally, including, without limitation, matters affecting persons generally, marriage, divorce, and matters of family law, tutorship, and curatorship, things generally, use and usufruct, servitudes, successions, donations, obligations generally, extinction of obligations, delicts and quasi delicts, matrimonial agreements, sales and leases, and prescriptions
Clerks of court and records of the courts
Code of Civil Procedure, and civil procedure generally
Code of Criminal Procedure and criminal procedure generally
Controlled dangerous substance law and procedure generally
Law enforcement generally, including the Department of Public Safety and state police
Miscellaneous matters not covered by other standing committees
Municipal and Parish Courts, Mayor's Courts and Justice of the Peace Courts
National Guard, Military affairs generally, Code of Military Justice, and the Adjutant General
Penal and correctional institutions, except for agribusiness programs, and juvenile and adult rehabilitation
Proposed amendments to the state constitution not specifically vested, as to subject matter, in another committee
Regulations and sale of intoxicating liquors
Sheriffs generally, except matters affecting sheriffs as ex officio tax collectors

Supreme Court, Courts of Appeal, District Courts, Family Courts, and Juvenile Courts, jurisdiction of said courts, and judges generally, including compensation, expenses, personnel, facilities, and the like, except retirement matters (aa) Traffic offenses and procedure (bb) Trust Code (cc) Weapons and explosives
Labor and Industrial Relations Committee, all matters relating to:
Collective bargaining and other labor laws affecting public employees
Labor retirement laws, except those related to public employees
Local and Municipal Affairs Committee, all matters relating to:
Assessors, their offices, salaries, expenses, compensation, etc.
Assistance to municipal and other local governments
Department of Urban and Community Affairs
Drainage and sewerage and water districts
Employees of local governments, except retirement
Intergovernmental relations between local governments and state and local governments
Local, parochial, and municipal affairs generally, except matters specifically placed under the jurisdiction of other committees
Revenue of and taxation levied by local governments
Natural Resources Committee, all matters relating to:
Accretion, alluvion, and dereliction of public and private lands
Coastal protection and restoration, including matters relating to the Coastal Protection and Restoration Authority.
Mineral lands and matters relating thereto
Mines and minerals and mineral code
Ownership of minerals and mineral lands
Retirement Committee, all matters relating to:

Retirement, including retirement systems supported in whole or in part by funds of the state or any of its political subdivisions, but excluding retirement matters concerning labor retirement laws related to nonpublic employees
Retirement of state officials and employees
School employees', teachers', and other education personnel retirement
Revenue and Fiscal Affairs Committee, all matters relating to:
Bond portion of the comprehensive state capital budget
Department of Revenue and Taxation, Tax Commission, and the Board of Tax Appeals
Deposit and investment of public monies
Economy and efficiency of government operations

Each legislative instrument which produces a net decrease in taxes or fees or produces an increase in taxes or fees, as reflected in the fiscal note prepared in accordance with Joint Rule No. 4, of five hundred thousand dollars or more annually in any one of the three ensuing fiscal years or produces an increase which, although unspecified in the fiscal note, is indicated in the fiscal note to likely exceed five hundred thousand dollars annually in any of the three ensuing fiscal years after initial consideration in the committee of subject matter, if different from Revenue and Fiscal Affairs.
Senate and Governmental Affairs Committee, all matters relating to:
Appointments which require confirmation by the Senate
Apportionment for public officials and governing authorities
Assignment of space in state buildings, including space for Senate and legislative needs
Capitol building and all other buildings for state government services in the state capital, including capitol parking
Classified and unclassified service for public employees
Creation of all legislative committees and proposals for interim studies by committees
Elections, state political parties and their committees and officers, procedure, and other matters relating to elections
Expenditures of funds by the legislature
Intergovernmental relations between the state and the United States or other states
Maintenance and care of capitol complex buildings
Rules and procedures of the Senate and the legislature
Rules or laws enacted to reorganize the legislative or executive branches of government
Services of or for the Senate and/or its committees and members
State buildings generally, including naming of state buildings
Transportation, Highways and Public Works Committee, all matters relating to:
Construction, improvement, and maintenance of waterways, lakes, and streams
Facilities in connection with lakes, waterways, and streams
Rules and Regulations for highway, railroad, and air use
Transportation, highways, and public works in general

Water conservation districts SR 53 of 1990; SR 47 of 1995 RS; SR 13 of 1996 1 st EX; SR 30 of 1997 RS; SR 17 of 2001 RS; SR 6 of 2002 RS; SR No. 9 of 2003 RS; SR 3 of 2008 1 st EX; SR 168 of 2014 RS, eff. August 1, 2014.
